briefdescription.para: Receive all the messages, unparsed, sent by the IRC server. This is not normally needed but provided for those who are interested.
Receive all the raw messages sent to the IRC from this connection.
Sets the text encoding used by the read and write streams. Must be set before Connect() is called and should not be changed while the connection is processing messages.
A read-only property indicating whether the connection has been opened with the IRC server and the client has been successfully registered.

detaileddescription.para: True if the client is connected and registered.

briefdescription.para: A read-only property indicating whether a connection has been opened with the IRC server (but not whether registration has succeeded).

detaileddescription.para: True if the client is connected.

briefdescription.para: By default the connection itself will handle the case where, while attempting to register the client's nick is already in use. It does this by simply appending 2 random numbers to the end of the nick.

detaileddescription.para: The NickError event is shows that the nick collision has happened and it is fixed by calling Sender's Register() method passing in the replacement nickname.
True if the connection should handle this case and false if the client will handle it itself.

briefdescription.para: A user friendly name of this Connection in the form 'nick'.
Whether Ctcp commands should be processed and if Ctcp events will be raised.

detaileddescription.para: True will enable the CTCP sender and listener and false will cause their property calls to return null.

briefdescription.para: Whether DCC requests should be processed or ignored by this Connection. Since the DccListener is a singleton and shared by all Connections, listeners to DccListener events should be manually removed when no longer needed.
Sets an automatic responder to Ctcp queries.

detaileddescription.para: Once this is set it can be removed by setting it to null.

briefdescription.para: The amount of time that has passed since the client sent a command to the IRC server.
The object used to send commands to the IRC server.
The object that parses messages and notifies the appropriate delegate.
The object used to send CTCP commands to the IRC server.

detaileddescription.para: Read only CtcpSender. Null if CtcpEnabled is false.

briefdescription.para: The object that parses CTCP messages and notifies the appropriate delegate.

detaileddescription.para: Read only CtcpListener. Null if CtcpEnabled is false.

briefdescription.para: The collection of data used to establish this connection.
A read-only collection of string key/value pairs representing IRC server proprties.

detaileddescription.para: This connection's ServerProperties obejct or null if it has not been created.

briefdescription.para: Used for internal test purposes only.
Respond to IRC keep-alives.

parameterdescription.para: The message that should be echoed back

briefdescription.para: Update the ConnectionArgs object when the user changes his nick.
Listen for the 005 info messages sent during registration so that the maximum lengths of certain items (Nick, Away, Topic) can be determined dynamically.
Read in message lines from the IRC server and send them to a parser for processing. Discard CTCP and DCC messages if these protocols are not enabled.
Send a message to the IRC server and clear the command buffer.
Send a message to the IRC server which does not affect the client's idle time. Used for automatic replies such as PONG or Ctcp repsones.
Prepare a connection to an IRC server but do not open it. This sets the text Encoding to Default.

parameterdescription.para: The set of information need to connect to an IRC server
True if this Connection should support CTCP.
True if this Connection should support DCC.

memberdef.argsstring: (Encoding textEncoding, ConnectionArgs args, bool enableCtcp, bool enableDcc)
memberdef.name: Connection

briefdescription.para: Prepare a connection to an IRC server but do not open it.

parameterdescription.para: The set of information need to connect to an IRC server
True if this Connection should support CTCP.
True if this Connection should support DCC.
The text encoding for the incoming stream.

briefdescription.para: Connect to the IRC server and start listening for messages on a new thread.

parameterdescription.para: If a connection cannot be established with the IRC server

briefdescription.para: Sends a 'Quit' message to the server, closes the connection, and stops the listening thread.

detaileddescription.para: The state of the connection will remain the same even after a disconnect, so the connection can be reopened. All the event handlers will remain registered.

parameterdescription.para: A message displayed to IRC users upon disconnect.

briefdescription.para: A friendly name for this connection.

Adds a parser class to a list of custom parsers. Any number can be added. The custom parsers will be tested using CanParse() before the default parsers. The last parser to be added will be the first to process a message.
Remove a custom parser class.
This class manages the connection to the IRC server and provides access to all the objects needed to send and receive messages.
